title: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, June 26, 2015
contenttemplated:
[{"content":"

Airing on Friday, June 26, 2015: First up, we'll talk about how health care marketplaces may adapt after the Supreme Court's decision on the Affordable Care Act. Next, we'll talk about Nissan buying the naming rights to the Tennessee Titan’s stadium. So what's in a stadium name? Turns out, millions of dollars. We also talk to Ariella Cohen of Next City about her outfit’s assertion that Rust Belt cities like Pittsburgh and Cleveland should focus on their manufacturing roots when it comes to startup funding and innovation. 

","type":"text/html"},{"type":"text/html","content":"

 

"}]

contentencoded: Airing on Friday, June 26, 2015: First up, we'll talk about how health care marketplaces may adapt after the Supreme Court's decision on the Affordable Care Act. Next, we'll talk about Nissan buying the naming rights to the Tennessee Titan’s stadium. So what's in a stadium name? Turns out, millions of dollars. We also talk to Ariella Cohen of Next City about her outfit’s assertion that Rust Belt cities like Pittsburgh and Cleveland should focus on their manufacturing roots when it comes to startup funding and innovation.
description: Airing on Friday, June 26, 2015: First up, we'll talk about how health care marketplaces may adapt after the Supreme Court's decision on the Affordable Care Act. Next, we'll talk about Nissan buying the naming rights to the Tennessee Titan’s stadium. So what's in a stadium name? Turns out, millions of dollars. We also talk to Ariella Cohen of Next City about her outfit’s assertion that Rust Belt cities like Pittsburgh and Cleveland should focus on their manufacturing roots when it comes to startup funding and innovation.
teaser: Airing on Friday, June 26, 2015: First up, we'll talk about how health care marketplaces may adapt after the Supreme Court's decision on the Affordable Care Act. Next, we'll talk about Nissan buying the naming rights to the Tennessee Titan’s stadium. So what's in a stadium name? Turns out, millions of dollars. We also talk to Ariella Cohen of Next City about her outfit’s assertion that Rust Belt cities like Pittsburgh and Cleveland should focus on their manufacturing roots when it comes to startup funding and innovation.
